Query: Faster completion of seed germination at low temperature (10C) compared to wild type.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Petals often absent (second whorl).

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Phenotype varies acropetally, with more complete flower-to-inflorescence conversions in basal flowers and at low temperature, lacks trichomes on stems and leaves, some trichomes in leaf margins.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Homeotic conversion of sepals, organ types vary from no leafy to lateral organs missing or filamentous with axial organs being sepal-carpels.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Many secondary or tertiary flowers are formed in the axils of transformed sepals.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Second whorl develops into stamens, stamen-petals or filaments.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: In the third whorl, organs in lateral positions are consistently missing, and numbers of axial organs are reduced, or may also form stamen- carpel organs.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Occasionally the carpels (fourth whorl) may remain unfused or be replaced by a number of stamens.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Reduced fertility with stamens shedding little pollen, and ovules appearing to degenerate.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Homeotic conversion of sepals, organ types found vary from leaf-like, to leaf-carpel, to sepal- carpel intermediate organs or small filaments.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Some secondary or tertiary flowers are formed in the axils of the transformed sepals.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Second whorl typically forms stamens, although filaments, petal-stamens or petal-sepals may also develop.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Third whorl is often missing the lateral stamens, and the number of axial stamens is reduced.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Fourth whorl may develop a multicarpellate pistil.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Homeotic conversion of sepals, organ types found vary from leaves, to leaf-sepal intermediate organs and to sepals and sepal-carpels.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Few secondary or tertiary flowers are formed in the axils of transformed sepals.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Second whorl organs form petals or filaments, or rarely petal-stamens and stamens.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Third whorl with organs in the position of lateral stamens commonly missing and organs in axial positions usually form stamens.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Petals and petaloid stamens predominate in the second whorl.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Double mutant, both alleles are strong, sterile, enhancement of lfy mutant phenotype.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Flowers transformed into inflorescences.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Effect stronger on early-arising flowers.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: No clear transition between secondary inflorescences and flower-like structures.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: The first two organs of the later-arising, transformed flowers arise laterally, similar to wild type.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Most organs are very leaf-like, similar to the first-whorl organs of ap1-1 single mutant.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: In the axils of the leaf-like organs, secondary buds arise.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: More severe phenotype under short days and lower temperature.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Indistinguishable from ap1-1 cal1-1 double mutant.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Upon DEX treatment, synchronized floral meristem formation is induced.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Reduction of the numbers of secondary flowers in ap1-4, partial rescue of the sepal axil secondary flower phenotype.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: No visible phenotype.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Flower meristems behave like inflorescence meristems and continuously elaborate new meristems, resulting in the 'cauliflower' phenotype.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Eventually flowers resembling those of ap1 single mutants eventually appear and set seeds.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Inflorescences take 7-10 days longer than ap1 cal mutant to begin producing flowers.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Meristem defect intermediate between that of ap1 and ap1 cal mutants.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Inflorescences appear caulifower-like early after bolting but soon start producing ap1-like flowers on their periphery.

Query: Hypersensitive to abscicic acid, gibberellic acid and paclobutrazol.
Matches: Unlike the agl24-2 svp-41 double mutant, where severe phenotypes similar to the lug mutant were only observed when plants were grown at 30°C, in the ap1-12 agl24-2 svp-41 triple mutant, severe lug-type phenotypes were observed under normal growing conditions (22°C).
